element_id.title: Element Id
element_id.description: Element ID unique in the context

amount.title: Amount to capture, if different from what was authorised

captured_amount.title: Amount in minor units that has been captured

refund_amount.title: Amount in minor units that has to be refunded

card_number_alias.title: Card number alias
card_number_alias.description: Alias of the card number, masked for PCI compliance. First 6 digits are the BIN

cvc_alias.description: Alias of CVC/CVV, masked for PCI compliance

expiry_date.title: Expiry date
expiry_date.description: The month and year the card expires

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: What is this currency for tokenising the card?

is_corporate_card.description: A flag that indicates whether this is a corporate card or not

receipt_email.title: Receipt email
receipt_email.description: An e-mail address to send receipt to

client_info.title: Client Info
client_info.description: Contains client info such as end users IP address

user_is_employee.title: User Is Employee
user_is_employee.description: User role used to possibly override routing rules

token.title: Payment Method token
token.description: Token generated in r-api to store with the payment method

addition_context.title: Payment method addition context
addition_context.description: Token can be added in SUBSCRIPTION or CHECKOUT contexts

TermUrlApp.description: TermUrl for shoppers using an app

client_token.title: Client Token
client_token.description: Token or URL used for client authorization

authorization.title: Authorization
authorization.description: Contains information that is needed for completing client authorization/authentication

id.title: Payment ID
id.description: The ID of the payment to be created

reference.title: Payment reference
reference.description: Identifier which can be used to reference this payment to a particular event, e.g. purchase, tip

payment_method_id.title: Payment method ID
payment_method_id.description: Unique identifier of a payment method to be used for payment

payment_method_type.title: Payment method type
payment_method_type.description: Unique identifier of a payment gateway such as Adyen, Credorax, Cibus and etc.

payment_service_provider.title: Payment service provider
payment_service_provider.description: Unique identifier of a payment gateway such as Adyen, Credorax, Cibus and etc.

external_token.title: ID of one of the payment methods available to the user

benefit_eligible_amount.title: Benefit eligible amount
benefit_eligible_amount.description: Amount of payment that can be paid using e.g. lunch benefit

platform.title: Order source platform
platform.description: Platform where the order took place

can_be_partial_capture.title: Can be partial capture
can_be_partial_capture.description: Whether payment can result in partial capture

is_merchant_initiated_transaction.title: Is merchant initiated transaction
is_merchant_initiated_transaction.description: Whether payment is initiated by customer or merchant

is_subscription_transaction.title: Is subscription transaction
is_subscription_transaction.description: Whether payment is for subscription purchase

require_customer_authentication.title: Require customer authentication
require_customer_authentication.description: Flag which controls whether customer authentication must be forced for the payment or not

initial_payment_id.title: ID of the payment that this payment references
initial_payment_id.description: This is how we chain subsequent recurring payments to original contract

group_order_id.title: Group order ID
group_order_id.description: ID of the group order if the related purchase is a group order

authorization.title: Authorization details
authorization.description: This attribute returned only when payment is in `authorization_required` status and contains information necessary to complete authorization

external_id.title: External ID
external_id.description: Unique ID provided by payment service provider

additional_data.title: Additional payment data, e.g. SCA exemption requested

created_by.title: The UUID of the refund initiator (refunds are typically initiated by a tech support member)

element_id.title: Element Id
element_id.description: Element ID unique in the context

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: Element subtitle, depends on the context, i.e. email address for the paypal. May contain placeholders in double curly braces. In that case subtitle_placeholders field should not be empty.

subtitle_placeholders.title: Subtitle Placeholders
subtitle_placeholders.description: Contains data that clients uses to substitute placeholders in the subtitle.

Credits.description: Shows amount of credits that can be used in current order.

value.title: Value
value.description: Integer amount in smallest national monetary unit.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of a user who initiated the payment

is_employee.title: Is Employee
is_employee.description: User role used to possibly override routing rules

timestamp_minutes.description: Date from the beginning of the day.

convert_to_local_tz.description: true: absolute value in UTC timezone, should be converted to local time zone, false: is relative timestamp, should be treated as local time zone timestamp.

day_index.description: 1 = Mon, 2 = Tue, 3 = Wed, 4 = Thu, 5 = Fri, 6 = Sat, 7 = Sun.

element_id.description: Element ID unique in the context

Disclaimer.description: Statement in small font usually in the end of the list.

month.title: Expiration Month
month.description: The month the payment method expires

refusal_reason.title: Localised refusal reason if status is failure

reference_id.description: Identifier which can be used to reference this payment to a particular event, e.g. purchase.

element_id.title: Element Id
element_id.description: Element ID unique in the context

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: Element subtitle, depends on the context, i.e. email address for the paypal. May contain placeholders in double curly braces. In that case subtitle_placeholders field should not be empty.

subtitle_placeholders.title: Subtitle Placeholders
subtitle_placeholders.description: Contains data that clients uses to substitute placeholders in the subtitle.

Group.title: Group
Group.description: Payment methods group, e.g. "Credit and debit cards".

name.title: Job name
name.description: Name of the job to start

amount.title: Amount in cents
amount.description: Monetary amount in cents, e.g.: 10.15 EUR = 1015 cents. This accounts for all minor units except Japane.g.: 100 JPY -> 10000 cents

value.title: Value
value.description: Format number, e.g. int as "30,000" or float as "3.1415".

This matches worldpay representation but lets see if
we can generalize into something of this sort

element_id.title: Element Id
element_id.description: Element ID unique in the context

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: Element subtitle, depends on the context, i.e. email address for the paypal. May contain placeholders in double curly braces. In that case subtitle_placeholders field should not be empty.

subtitle_placeholders.title: Subtitle Placeholders
subtitle_placeholders.description: Contains data that clients uses to substitute placeholders in the subtitle.

expiry_state.description: Expiry state for cards. If expiry state is not valid, then expiry_date should be present, and subtitle should end with a '.'. soon_expired = card will expire this month.

is_wrapped_subtitle.title: Is Wrapped Subtitle
is_wrapped_subtitle.description: If this flag is set then long subtitle will be broken into multiple lines, otherwise cut to fit available line length.

is_selected.title: Is Selected
is_selected.description: Marks this method as selected for payment

is_enabled.title: Is Enabled
is_enabled.description: If this flag is not set then this list item will be greyed out and unclickable.

is_default.title: Is Default
is_default.description: True if it is user's application-wide default method

root_element.title: Root Element
root_element.description: A node of UI tree, base class for all concrete types. Descendants should contain `element_type`, `element_id` and optional `children` fields.

liability_shift.title: Liability shift
liability_shift.description: A Boolean value indicating whether a liability shift was offered for this payment

network_transaction_id.title: Network transaction ID
network_transaction_id.description: Transaction identifier from card schemes, for example, Mastercard Trace ID or the Visa Transaction ID

card.title: Authorized card
card.description: Detailed information on the authorized card: BIN, issuer, country, etc.

payment_method_id.title: Payment method ID
payment_method_id.description: Unique identifier of a payment method to be used for payment

subscription.title: Is subscription transaction
subscription.description: Whether payment is for subscription purchase

merchant_initiated.title: Is merchant initiated transaction
merchant_initiated.description: Whether payment is initiated by customer or merchant

rrn.title: Retrieval reference number (RRN)
rrn.description: A key to uniquely identify a card transaction based on the ISO 8583 standard

type.title: Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML).

title.title: Title
title.description: A short, summary of the problem type. Written in english and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized)

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.title: Instance
instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

error_code.title: Error Code
error_code.description: Custom error code returned from third-party PSP or other APIs.

payment_method_id.title: Payment method id
payment_method_id.description: Wolt payment method id, mappable to PSP tokens

cvc_alias.title: CVC/CVV alias
cvc_alias.description: Alias of CVC/CVV, masked for PCI compliance

expiry_date.title: Expiry date
expiry_date.description: The month and year the card expires

created_by.title: The UUID of the refund initiator (refunds are typically initiated by a tech support member)

note.title: Refund reason note where customer support explains the reason for the refund

timestamp_minutes.title: Timestamp Minutes
timestamp_minutes.description: Timestamp in minutes from the beginning of the day.

convert_to_local_tz.title: Convert To Local Tz
convert_to_local_tz.description: true: absolute value in UTC timezone, should be converted to local time zone, false: is relative timestamp, should be treated as local time zone timestamp.

is_corporate_card.title: Corporate card
is_corporate_card.description: A flag that indicates whether this is a corporate card or not

receipt_email.title: Receipt email
receipt_email.description: An e-mail address to send receipt to

status.title: Status
status.description: Allows us to manually enable or disable payment methods

id.title: Venue ID
id.description: Unique identifier of the venue as ObjectId

city.title: Venue city name
city.description: Venue city name or delivery area in english

redirect_url.title: Redirect URL
redirect_url.description: URL which the client must redirect to in order to complete 3DS1 payment authorization

data.title: 3DS data
data.description: Data in a gateway specific format which is returned to the client in order to complete 3DS payment authorization

action.title: Action identifier
action.description: Action which the client should do to continue the payment authorization

provider.title: Provider identifier
provider.description: Provider which the client should use to do the provided action

callback_url.title: Callback URL
callback_url.description: Callback URL which the client must use to send the challenge result in order to complete 3DS2 payment authorization
